context 0: Medi, what is bone erosion in rheumatoid arthritis?
context 1: Bone erosion is a central feature of rheumatoid arthritis. It occurs due to inflammation of the synovium, caused by the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines and receptor activator of nuclear factor kappa B ligand. This triggers osteoclast activity and leads to bone damage.
context 2: Can bone erosion be prevented?
context 3: While bone erosion in rheumatoid arthritis cannot be completely prevented, early treatment and management of inflammation can help minimize its impact.
